speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Doug, this is Dr. Frasier Crane.  I'm listening.

speaker: Doug
text: [_v.o:_] Look, it's about my mother.  She's getting on now and she doesn't have much of a life.  And she doesn't want to do anything or go anywhere and she literally hangs around the house all day.  I mean, it's very frustrating...

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry Doug, can we just go back a second?  You said your mother literally hangs around the house.  Well, I suppose it's a pet peeve of mine but I suppose what you mean is that she figuratively "hangs around" the house.  To literally hang around the house you'd have to be a bat or spider monkey. Now, back to your problem?

speaker: Doug
text: Do you mind if we stop while I tell you my pet peeve?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not at all.

speaker: Doug
text: [_angry_] I hate it when intellectual pinheads with superiority complexes nit-pick your grammar when they come to you for help.  That's what I got a problem with! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_happily:_] I think what he means is, that is a thing with which he has a problem.  Now it's time for a station break and we'll be right back after a word from our friends at [_reads:_] "Pizza, Pizza, Pizza."

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, do you want to know my pet peeve?  It's when you're in a department store and the clerk is right in the middle of helping you and the phone rings.  So he starts taking care of them.  And you're left standing there going, "Excuse me, but all I did was come all the way down here in person, whilst some joker is sitting at home in his underwear getting first rate service!"  Don't you hate that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I do most of my shopping by phone.  You know Roz, this conversation with Doug has got me thinking about my father.  He doesn't do much of anything either.  He just sits around most of the time watching TV and doing the occasional crossword puzzle.  What does your mother do?

speaker: Roz
text: She's the attorney general of Wisconsin.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not believing:_] No, really!

speaker: Roz
text: Really!

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess that helps fill her day.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, quote mom, "Crime never stops - even in the dairy state!"

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] I don't think public office is for Dad, but maybe I could find him a hobby or something.  Any suggestions?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, in her spare time my mom likes to water ski a little. She hikes, oil paints... oh, she likes archaeology.  She's on a dig in Honduras right now.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_making up for it:_] Well, maybe I could get him a wood burning set.   **A ROOM WITH A VIEW**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne enters from the bedroom to find Frasier standing near the balcony assembling a telescope._

speaker: Frasier
text: Is Dad still asleep?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, he's napping with the dog.  Eddie's little legs are going like mad.  I think he's dreaming about chasing rabbits. [_thinks_] I can't explain your father's twitching!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_focusing telescope:_] I think I'm just about done with this thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: I think your dad's going to love it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me, too.  I was walking through the hobby shop and saw this thing and it was like, "Eureka!"  I actually said "Eureka!" [_looking through scope:_] Ah, yes.  There are a million stories in the naked city. [_hopeful:_] Now if we could just find a naked one.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_mock anger:_] Dr. Crane, you naughty boy.  Peeking in on other people's privacy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, really.  I mean, if people were so concerned about their precious privacy they wouldn't leave their blinds open at that certain angle where you can see the mirror over the mantle that reflects down the hall to the water bed in the back room!

speaker: Daphne
text: I think I hear your father coming.  Stand in front of it, we'll make this a little surprise.  _They stand in front of the telescope so Martin at first won't be able to see it.  Martin enters from his room._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: How was your nap?

speaker: Martin
text: Great, I had the strangest dream.  I dreamt this beautiful woman with bad breath was licking my face.  _At this point Eddie comes out the bedroom and jumps onto the sofa. Martin realizes the source of the dream._

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Eddie:_] Hey, where did you just come from?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I got a surprise for you.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, it's a beaut.  What's the occasion?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no occasion, just thought you'd like it.

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, that's great, thanks.  You know, I saw in the news there's a bunch of falcons nesting in the eaves of the Columbia Tower.  Maybe I can watch them from here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad, forget the falcons.  You can see everything that's going on in that apartment building over there.

speaker: Martin
text: [_objecting:_] Hey, I've locked people up for that kind of behavior.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh come on, it's perfectly innocent - just think of it as a hundred more channels to watch.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looking in scope:_] Just look at them, people going about their lives.  There's an old couple watching the telly, and just next door an attractive young woman is working at a computer, while below her a burly man is using a beach towel to soak up a large pool of blood... oh my God!

speaker: Martin
text: What?  _Both Martin and Frasier go to look - banging their heads in doing so. Frasier stands aside to let the cop have a look:_

speaker: Martin
text: [_looking:_] No, that's tomato juice - you can see the can on the counter.  You're right about that woman at the computer though, she's a looker.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, you see, there's a voyeur in all of us.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, let's see what else the Seattle skyline has to offer.

speaker: Daphne
text: I say we make a strict rule, though: if anybody starts doing anything nasty we move on.  Agreed? [_they don't respond_] I said, agreed?  _They eventually relent, look at each other and respond with a reluctant "yeah."_

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs:_] Well, there's a lady over there with a telescope. She's looking right back at us.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_nervous:_] What shall we do?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_worried:_] Hide!  _Frasier goes for cover behind the fireplace as Daphne ducks behind the centre pole._

speaker: Frasier
text: I knew it, I knew it, every time we do something bad we get caught!

speaker: Martin
text: [_waves and shouts:_] Hi, how you doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Martin
text: She's waving at us, I'm waving back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't do that!

speaker: Martin
text: Why not?  Hey wait, she's writing something down.  She's holding it up.  It says, "Hello there, stranger." [_laughs_] Hey Daphne, get me that pad and pen.

speaker: Frasier
text: What for?

speaker: Martin
text: So I can answer her.  Write down "My name is Martin."

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad you shouldn't encourage this person.  I don't really want people looking in on our lives.  I don't think I've even made my bed today.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is she writing anything else?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah. [_reads:_] "My name is Irene."  Her name's Irene.

speaker: Daphne
text: Her name's Irene.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic:_] Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: Wait, she's writing something else. [_reads:_] "Is that Dr. Crane from the radio hiding in the back?"

speaker: Frasier
text: It does not say that! [_looks_] It does say that. [_he waves back:_] Hi! _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Three mornings later Martin is sitting on a stool looking through the telescope.  There are reams of wadded-up paper laying near him. Daphne is sitting on the step scribbling down Martin's dictations._

speaker: Martin
text: Her older son's an accountant in Portland.

speaker: Daphne
text: He was the breech birth, right?

speaker: Martin
text: No, that's Dennis in Boise.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh right, he's the one with the wife that won't let him visit.  I can't stand her.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_enters from room in gown:_] Morning Dad, Daphne. [_waves to window:_] Morning, Irene.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Frasier, when you were a kid, what was the name of that skin condition you had on your butt?

speaker: Frasier
text: Pityriasis Rosea.

speaker: Daphne
text: How do you spell that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_curious:_] Why?

speaker: Martin
text: Irene and I are exchanging family histories.

speaker: Frasier
text: I really don't think your girlfriend needs to know about that.

speaker: Martin
text: [_objecting:_] She's not my girlfriend!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on.  You two have been exchanging notes now for the past three days.  If you were in the sixth grade you would be sitting in a tree "K-I-S-S-I-N-G."  Here Daphne, let me borrow that pen. [_he does_]

speaker: Martin
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm going to help along your little romance and possibly save a small forest.  I'm giving her our telephone number.

speaker: Martin
text: [_in terror:_] No, no, no, no, no, don't do that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she'll think I'm being too forward.

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, Dad, you met peeping into her apartment.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sure:_] She's not going to call.

speaker: Frasier
text: You want to bet?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, five bucks.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_holds card up:_] Okay. _There is less than a second of silence before the phone begins to ring and Frasier smirks at his father smugly._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, are you going to answer?

speaker: Martin
text: You get it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, it's for you!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone:_] Hello.  No, no, this is Frasier.  Hi.  I'm fine. Well, it gets a little flaky when the weather's dry. [_rubs butt_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_whispers:_] Tell her I'm not home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, she knows you're home - she's looking at you through the telescope.

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on, you're just a little nervous.

speaker: Martin
text: [_into phone at last:_] Hello?  Hi.  Yeah, it's nice hearing yours.  Can you hold on a minute? [_puts phone to his chest, then to Frasier and Daphne:_] Would you two get out of here?  _Daphne and Frasier relent and let him have his private conversation.  Reset to: Kitchen They enter the kitchen where they chat._

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm getting a very good feeling about this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really? You really think he's interested in her?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs:_] Yes, I think so.  _They chuckle along together as Daphne takes a coffee cake out of the oven._

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you want to hear something cute, Dr. Crane?  I made him this rich gooey coffee cake this morning, because you know what a sweet tooth he has.  And he wouldn't take one bite because - as he put it - "Women don't like a spare tire on a man."

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] That's so cute.  Oh, it's funny, you know - the twists and turns of fate.  If I had tried to set Dad up with a woman he would have rejected the idea out of hand - but I go out get him this telescope for a hobby and it kindles this romance.  It's Kismet!  _As Daphne begins cutting the cake, Martin enters the kitchen and begins looking in the fridge without saying a word.  Frasier and Daphne just stare at him until:_

speaker: Frasier
text: Well?

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: What happened?

speaker: Martin
text: [_cool:_] We talked on the phone.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_knowingly:_] And?  Was she nice, was she interesting?  What did she say?

speaker: Martin
text: She said a lot of stuff.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_certain:_] So it would be safe to assume that you two will be seeing each other?

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, she wanted to, but I said no.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_confused:_] No?  Why?

speaker: Martin
text: She's not my type. [_notices cake, then enthusiastically:_] Oh, coffee cake!  We got any butter round here? **FORCAS FRACAS**  _Scene Four - Caf e Nervosa. That afternoon Frasier and Niles are having on of their snobby chats in their sanctuary._

speaker: Niles
text: You know Brewster Cale?  The pompous twit who is the president of our wine club? [_Frasier nods._] Well, at our meeting the other night I convinced some of my fellow psychiatrists to play a little prank on him.  When he thought he was tasting the Chateau Petrus, he was in fact sipping a Forcas Dupres. You see, we'd switched the labels. [_laughs at the farce_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic:_] What scamps you are!

speaker: Niles
text: There he was, proclaiming the Petrus to be the superior wine and of course none of us could contain our laughter.

speaker: Frasier
text: His face must have turned redder than a "Piechone Logeavie."

speaker: Niles
text: Well of course, as so often happens, rough house turns to tears.  At the end of the evening, Brewster tended his resignation.

speaker: Frasier
text: That must have put a damper on the evening.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, not really.  I'm the new president.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kudos indeed.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, oh, is our dad and his lady friend still playing telescope footsy?  What was her name?

speaker: Frasier
text: Irene.  No, they've broken it off.

speaker: Niles
text: Already?  I thought it was going so well.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well it was, but then they spoke once and Dad said that she wasn't his type. [_objecting:_] So, it's over - done! He's completely cut her out of his life.  I just don't understand what would make him do that.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, who knows why anybody does anything?

speaker: Frasier
text: Remind me again what you do for a living?  You see the thing is, it was just one phone call.  How can anyone make a sound judgment about another person on the basis of one phone call?

speaker: Niles
text: Remind me again what it is YOU do for a living?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well anyway, I suppose it could be any number of reasons. Fear of rejection, shyness...

speaker: Niles
text: [_obviously leading up to something_] Or maybe Dad was telling the truth and he just wasn't her type.  If only we knew someone who was... I know!  Maris's lovely Aunt Patrice is in town visiting from Washington, D.C.  Oh, oh, oh, maybe we should set Dad up with her.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_objecting:_] No, Niles, I've met Aunt Patrice.  The woman is a loon.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, do this for me.  Every time Aunt Patrice comes to visit, Maris makes all these plans, before she dives under the duvet with a two-week migraine and I'm left holding the bag-- literally and figuratively.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't think so, Niles.  I know Dad, don't meddle.

speaker: Niles
text: Alright, the least you could do is say hello to Aunt Patrice.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not driving out to your house.

speaker: Niles
text: You don't have to.  She's sitting out in the car.

speaker: Frasier
text: You left her in the car?!

speaker: Niles
text: I cracked open a window.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then she's fine.  _End Of Act One. (Time: 11:48)  Act Two.  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is on the phone to his son that evening as Martin sits reading the paper._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone:_] Now calm down son, listen to daddy.  It's just a bad dream.  I promise you, Senator Thurmond is not in your closet.  That's a good boy.  Yes, okay you go back to bed now. I love you too.  Listen, I'll see you next weekend.  Okay, bye bye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Martin
text: How's Freddie?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Frederick is fine.  Oh, he sends his love.  He said to thank you for the toy gun you gave him.  At least what he can remember of it before Lilith smashed it to bits with a croquet mallet.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters and looks through telescope:_] Oh it's such a beautiful night.  The city is lit up like a jewel.  Oh look, there's Irene.  She's sitting in her window wearing a stunning green dress.  But her face, it's so sad.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks:_] Oh, oh, she's holding a note.  It says, "Martin, was it something I wrote?"

speaker: Martin
text: Will you cut it out?  Irene is not sitting in her window.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh alright Dad, no she isn't, but she might as well be, for god's sakes.  That's gotta be what she's thinking!

speaker: Martin
text: Haven't you ever met a woman and then decide she's not the one? [_doorbell sounds_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, five years after I married her.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello there, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles - I was specifically not expecting you.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you remember Aunt Patrice.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_greets her:_] Well, of course.  Aunt Patrice, yes.  I don't recall really when we met but I believe there was a lot of laughing and dancing.

speaker: Patrice
text: My husband's funeral.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes... well, of course, the laughter was to hide our tears. Let me take your wrap. [_he does_]

speaker: Patrice
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: We were taking a drive and I thought, "Why, we are just a couple of short ferry rides from Frasier's," so we decided to pop over.

speaker: Patrice
text: [_pointing at Martin:_] Niles, is this the charming gentleman you were telling me about?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Patrice, you bloodhound.  You've treed another one!  Yes, this is my dad.

speaker: Martin
text: How do you do, Patrice, I'm Martin Crane.  This is Daphne Moon.

speaker: Daphne
text: Nice to meet you. [_points to seat:_] Please.

speaker: Patrice
text: Thank you. [_sits_]

speaker: Martin
text: So, what brings you to Seattle?

speaker: Patrice
text: Well, I came to see Maris, but the poor thing's taken to her bed again.  To this day I have no idea how tall she is.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, so I've had Patrice all to myself and we've had a great time, haven't we?

speaker: Patrice
text: Well, if you call sitting in your waiting room for four hours reading old magazines a great time, well then yes - we had a laugh riot.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, now I know where Maris gets her sense of humor!

speaker: Patrice
text: [_laughs_] Oh.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why don't I pop into the kitchen and gets us all some refreshments?

speaker: Niles
text: A capital idea, and why don't Frasier and I join you?  That'll give these kids some time to get to know one another.  _Reset to: Kitchen Niles, Frasier and Daphne enter the kitchen.  Daphne knocks up some refreshments as Frasier gives Niles a stern lecture._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I distinctly told you not to bring her here.

speaker: Niles
text: I ran out of ways to entertain her.  We went to the arboretum, a fashion show, a matinee of "La Cage Aux Folles" and we even spat off the top of the Space Needle.  I'm sorry, I cracked!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, that woman is certainly not Dad's type.

speaker: Niles
text: You never know when love can bloom between two people who seem so different on the surface. [_hoping:_] Do you, Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: To tell you the truth, I never thought opposites attract.

speaker: Niles
text: Neither do I, we are alike in so many ways!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh come on, Niles.  We can't leave Dad out there alone with her any longer. _Reset to: Living Room They re-enter the living room._

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sure they're doing just fine.

speaker: Patrice
text: [_o.s.:_] D'goo y'goo sp'geak g-sp'geak?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Lord, I was afraid of this.  _Martin is having trouble with her in the room as Niles and Frasier dash in._

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Patrice
text: [_slower:_] D'goo y'goo sp'geak g-sp'geak?

speaker: Martin
text: [_worried:_] Niles, I think she's having a stroke or something.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no Dad.  It's just G-speak.

speaker: Martin
text: Come again?

speaker: Niles
text: It's something Maris and Aunt Patrice love to try out at parties.

speaker: Patrice
text: Yes, you just speak a "g" in every syllable.  So you would be, "M'garg-tin Cr'gane."  Just say it with me, come on... M'garg-tin...

speaker: Niles
text: I don't think Dad's interested.

speaker: Patrice
text: Oh, b'ge ag sp'gort, Gniles.

speaker: Frasier
text: What did she say?

speaker: Niles
text: She said, "Be a sport, Niles."

speaker: Patrice
text: B'ge, agus, gesport, geda!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, do you still have your gun loaded?

speaker: Martin
text: It's in my top drawer.

speaker: Patrice
text: Isn't it a hoot?  Of course, it's all the rage in Washington. You know who speaks it all the time?  G'George G'Step-gan-ogp-ogu-logs.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters from kitchen:_] I found some pizza rolls in the back of the freezer, but the expiration date was yesterday - are we game?

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, that won't be necessary, Daphne.  We don't want to spoil our appetites for that dinner we're about to leave for in twenty minutes.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, that's right, that dinner in... er... twenty minutes.

speaker: Patrice
text: Oh Niles, I told you we shouldn't have just stopped by. These people have plans.

speaker: Niles
text: How I envy them.

speaker: Patrice
text: I enjoyed meeting you, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shakes her hand_] Likewise.

speaker: Patrice
text: Oh, now, now, you can do better than that.  _Patrice moves in to hug him, however he backs away and also away from the window.  Frasier and Daphne look at each other knowingly. Patrice finally gets what she wanted._

speaker: Patrice
text: I'll look forward to my next trip to Seattle.  Oh, and if you're ever in the Washington area - I'm in the b'gook. Bye-bye.

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell was that?

speaker: Daphne
text: I feel sorry for the poor thing.

speaker: Martin
text: I feel sorry for Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's who I'm talking about.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I saw what you just did.

speaker: Martin
text: What did who do?

speaker: Frasier
text: When Patrice went to hug you, you moved away.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs_] Well, wouldn't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, no.  You moved away from the window.  You didn't want Irene to see you with another woman.  You still care about her.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, go chase yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you do.  There's something stopping you from having a relationship with this woman.  Now, what is it?

speaker: Martin
text: You're not going to let go of this thing, are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm not!

speaker: Martin
text: Alright.  Irene's middle name is Rose.

speaker: Frasier
text: So?  Rose is a nice name.  Rose was mother's middle name. [_realises_] Oh.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Dad, you can't feel guilty about that.  Gee, mom's been gone for six years now.  Your feelings for Irene are totally severed from your feelings for Mom.  You know, if she was here, if she could tell you, she'd want you to get on with your life.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, when I'm ready.  Thanks, Frasier.  You know - I guess I don't say it often enough but you're a good kid.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thanks Dad.  You know, there's something I don't say often enough...

speaker: Martin
text: [_correcting:_] There's nothing you don't say often enough.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizes what he means_] Right, Dad. _Reset to: Kitchen Martin enters the kitchen to find Daphne busying herself in the fridge._

speaker: Daphne
text: I couldn't help but overhear.  That was a very nice thing to say.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he's a good kid.

speaker: Daphne
text: The only strange part is - I could have sworn Irene's middle name was Marie.

speaker: Martin
text: No, it isn't.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I could go and check.  I still have all our notes in the trash.

speaker: Martin
text: Alright, alright... well, I had to tell him something.  Look, I don't know why he just won't believe me when I tell him that Irene just isn't my type.

speaker: Daphne
text: You sure she isn't?

speaker: Martin
text: You're going to get on my back too?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, but I was just wondering if the reason why things didn't work out between you and Irene was, well...

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, maybe if you weren't just a little self-conscious about your hip?

speaker: Martin
text: That's ridiculous.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm glad to hear that, because you really don't have anything to be self-conscious about, you know.  With that silvery mane, twinkling blue eyes and whiskey voice.  You're quite a package.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs_] Yeah, I'm quite a catch.

speaker: Daphne
text: You are.  And you know as well as I do that history is full of sexy limpers.  For instance, Franklin Delano Roosevelt. [_then:_] Of course he didn't limp so much as roll.  Oh, I know, Toulouse Lautrec. [_then:_] Although he was rather a little person.  Still, he did rather well with the ladies. [_then:_] Of course, they were all prostitutes.  But then again, he was French and there's no explaining their taste.

speaker: Martin
text: What's your point?

speaker: Daphne
text: I guess I don't have one.  It's just me running on the way I do.  But there is one last little thing: I did notice that every time you went to the telescope to see Irene - you hid your cane.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs_] I just put it off to the side so I wouldn't trip over the damn thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_seeing she's got through:_] I knew there was a good reason. It must feel awful silly when that cane trips you up.  _Daphne exits as Martin ponders on her words.  FADE TO:_  **GU-GULP**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Later that evening Frasier and Daphne are waiting.  Frasier is calling for his father down the hallway._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad, will you hurry up?  She's going to be here any minute.

speaker: Martin
text: Alright, alright, Daphne.  See if I've got this tie on right?

speaker: Daphne
text: Just needs a minor adjustment. [_she does it, then:_] What's all this hair on it?

speaker: Martin
text: The only way I can get the knot right is if I tie it on Eddie first.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's a long time since I've been dating.  Have things changed much in the last forty years?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the wardrobe's a little different - but your ultimate goal is still the same!  Dad, I'm glad you changed your mind about this.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, me too.  Thanks for our little talk.

speaker: Frasier
text: My pleasure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now let's see, you got a hanky in there?

speaker: Martin
text: Yep.

speaker: Frasier
text: Terrific, alright.  Have you got your keys?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're not going to be out too late, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm just busting your chops here.  _The doorbell goes and both Frasier and Martin go "Oh My God." To understand this scene you've got to realize that Daphne and Frasier seem to act like the mother and father and Martin seems to be their kid going on a first date._

speaker: Daphne
text: Will you two relax?  A word to the wise, though: if she asks you up to her place after dinner - close the drapes! [_laughs_]  _Martin opens the door.  The view is from Irene's P.O.V. Martin is very blushing at the front whilst Frasier and Daphne look on the scene with happiness from behind._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Irene.  Nice to finally meet you. _
